title: I have been trying to write a story, but I just realized I don’t have any side characters. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Familiarize yourself with Joseph Campbell’s Hero’s Journey—found on the internet—and then graph the plots of The Wizard of Oz and Star Wars as samples, templates. They are, not by accident, the same story. Fill in your own hero, “helpers,” and plot (the journey). Voila! You’re there—-you’ve got your ingredients—-your roadmap and cast. Then write, write, write. 5–10 pages a day.
Keep writing the story. The only thing a story can't do without is a story. You probably don't have side characters (whatever you mean by that) because the story doesn't need any.
